result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheldon R. Davids was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
Submit DNA sample.
Pictures & prints.
All financials same as noted above.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheldon R. Davids

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sheldon R. Davids in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Arguments as to penalty.  Court imposes $250 fine + costs and DNA sample.

Defendant Sheldon R. Davids in court.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he has contacted 2 attorneys and will see one of them this week.  Court will adjourn for two weeks.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sheldon R. Davids in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE re: attorney.  DE is trying to hire attorney.  ADA Niemi states JT is scheduled for Oct. 14.  Court questions DE why attorney not hired yet and explains the purpose of FPT.  DE asks for recommendation.  ADA Niemi makes offer.   DE wishes to resolve today, changes plea to NC.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE. DE changes mind, want to hire attorney.  Court reminds DE Jury Trial will be held Oct. 14 , beginning 8:15 in chambers and reviews procedures for day of trial.  Court warns parties change of plea on the day of trial may result in Jury costs being assessed, reminds DE of bond conditions.

Pictures and prints.
No contact with S.S. Jr. or Sr.

Defendant Sheldon R. Davids in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now. DA recommend a fine and costs of $768.00.  No contest plea then changes mind and defendant enters a plea of not guilty.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
